max_retries.Description: Maximum number of HTTP client retries

retry_max_delay.Description: Maximum delay in milliseconds between retries of a request

retry_min_delay.Description: Minimum delay in milliseconds between retries of a request

retry_on_status_codes.Description: HTTP replies status codes to retry on

revision.Description: The _revision property describes the current revision of the resource. To prevent clients from overwriting each other's changes, PUT operations must include the current _revision of the resource, which clients should obtain by issuing a GET operation. If the _revision provided in a PUT request is missing or stale, the operation will be rejected

applied_to.Description: List of objects where the rules in this section will be enforced. This will take precedence over rule level appliedTo

is_valid.Description: A boolean flag which will be set to false if the referenced NSX resource has been deleted

target_display_name.Description: Display name of the NSX resource

display_name.Description: The display name of this resource. Defaults to ID if not set

is_default.Description: A boolean flag which reflects whether a firewall section is default section or not

revision.Description: The _revision property describes the current revision of the resource. To prevent clients from overwriting each other's changes, PUT operations must include the current _revision of the resource, which clients should obtain by issuing a GET operation. rule.Description: List of firewall rules in the section. Only homogeneous rules are supported

action.Description: Action enforced on the packets which matches the firewall rule

applied_to.Description: List of objects where rule will be enforced. The section level field overrides this one. Null will be treated as any

is_valid.Description: A boolean flag which will be set to false if the referenced NSX resource has been deleted

target_display_name.Description: Display name of the NSX resource

destination.Description: List of the destinations. Null will be treated as any

is_valid.Description: A boolean flag which will be set to false if the referenced NSX resource has been deleted

target_display_name.Description: Display name of the NSX resource

destinations_excluded.Description: When this boolean flag is set to true, the rule destinations will be negated

direction.Description: Rule direction in case of stateless firewall rules. This will only be considered if section level parameter is set to stateless. Default to IN_OUT if not specified

disabled.Description: Flag to disable rule. Disabled will only be persisted but never provisioned/realized

display_name.Description: Defaults to ID if not set

ip_protocol.Description: Type of IP packet that should be matched while enforcing the rule (IPV4, IPV6, IPV4_IPV6)

logged.Description: Flag to enable packet logging. Default is disabled

notes.Description: User notes specific to the rule

revision.Description: The _revision property describes the current revision of the resource. To prevent clients from overwriting each other's changes, PUT operations must include the current _revision of the resource, which clients should obtain by issuing a GET operation. If the _revision provided in a PUT request is missing or stale, the operation will be rejected

rule_tag.Description: User level field which will be printed in CLI and packet logs

service.Description: List of the services. Null will be treated as any

is_valid.Description: A boolean flag which will be set to false if the referenced NSX resource has been deleted

target_display_name.Description: Display name of the NSX resource

source.Description: List of sources. Null will be treated as any

is_valid.Description: A boolean flag which will be set to false if the referenced NSX resource has been deleted

target_display_name.Description: Display name of the NSX resource

sources_excluded.Description: When this boolean flag is set to true, the rule sources will be negated

section_type.Description: Type of the rules which a section can contain. Only homogeneous sections are supported

stateful.Description: Stateful or Stateless nature of firewall section is enforced on all rules inside the section

If the _revision provided in a PUT request is missing or stale, the operation will be rejected

rise_count.Description: Number of consecutive checks that must pass before marking it up

tag.Description: Set of opaque identifiers meaningful to the user

timeout.Description: Number of seconds the target has to respond to the monitor request

display_name.Description: The display name of this resource. Defaults to ID if not set

max_fails.Description: When the consecutive failures reach this value, then the member is considered temporarily unavailable for a configurable period

revision.Description: The _revision property describes the current revision of the resource. To prevent clients from overwriting each other's changes, PUT operations must include the current _revision of the resource, which clients should obtain by issuing a GET operation. If the _revision provided in a PUT request is missing or stale, the operation will be rejected

tag.Description: Set of opaque identifiers meaningful to the user

timeout.Description: After this timeout period, the member is tried again for a new connection to see if it is available

active_monitor_id.Description: Active health monitor Id. If one is not set, the active healthchecks will be disabled

algorithm.Description: Load balancing algorithm controls how the incoming connections are distributed among the members

display_name.Description: The display name of this resource. Defaults to ID if not set

member.Description: List of server pool members. Each pool member is identified, typically, by an IP address and a port

backup_member.Description: A boolean flag which reflects whether this is a backup pool member

display_name.Description: Pool member name

max_concurrent_connections.Description: To ensure members are not overloaded, connections to a member can be capped by the load balancer. When a member reaches this limit, it is skipped during server selection. If it is not specified, it means that connections are unlimited

port.Description: If port is specified, all connections will be sent to this port. Only single port is supported. If unset, the same port the client connected to will be used, it could be overrode by default_pool_member_port setting in virtual server. The port should not specified for port range case

weight.Description: Pool member weight is used for WEIGHTED_ROUND_ROBIN balancing algorithm. The weight value would be ignored in other algorithms

member_group.Description: Dynamic pool members for the loadbalancing pool. When member group is defined, members setting should not be specified

grouping_object.Description: Load balancer pool support grouping object as dynamic pool members. The IP list of the grouping object such as NSGroup would be used as pool member IP setting

is_valid.Description: A boolean flag which will be set to false if the referenced NSX resource has been deleted

target_display_name.Description: Display name of the NSX resource

ip_version_filter.Description: Ip revision filter is used to filter IPv4 or IPv6 addresses from the grouping object. If the filter is not specified, both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses would be used as server IPs

limit_ip_list_size.Description: Specifies whether to limit pool members. If false, dynamic pool can grow up to the load balancer max pool member capacity.

max_ip_list_size.Description: Limits the max number of pool members to the specified value if limit_ip_list_size is set to true, ignored otherwise.

port.Description: If port is specified, all connections will be sent to this port. If unset, the same port the client connected to will be used

min_active_members.Description: The minimum number of members for the pool to be considered active

passive_monitor_id.Description: Passive health monitor Id. If one is not set, the passive healthchecks will be disabled

revision.Description: The _revision property describes the current revision of the resource. To prevent clients from overwriting each other's changes, PUT operations must include the current _revision of the resource, which clients should obtain by issuing a GET operation. If the _revision provided in a PUT request is missing or stale, the operation will be rejected

ip.Description: Ip address or Ip range for SNAT of type SNAT_IP_POOL

port_overload.Description: Maximum times for reusing the same SNAT IP and port for multiple backend connections

type.Description: Type of SNAT performed to ensure reverse traffic from the server can be received and processed by the loadbalancer

tag.Description: Set of opaque identifiers meaningful to the user

tcp_multiplexing_enabled.Description: TCP multiplexing allows the same TCP connection between load balancer and the backend server to be used for sending multiple client requests from different client TCP connections

tcp_multiplexing_number.Description: The maximum number of TCP connections per pool that are idly kept alive for sending future client requests

display_name.Description: The display name of this resource. Defaults to ID if not set

is_secure.Description: This flag is set to true when all the ciphers and protocols are secure. It is set to false when one of the ciphers or protocols is insecure

protocols.Description: SSL versions TLS1.1 and TLS1.2 are supported and enabled by default. SSLv2, SSLv3, and TLS1.0 are supported, but disabled by default

revision.Description: The _revision property describes the current revision of the resource. To prevent clients from overwriting each other's changes, PUT operations must include the current _revision of the resource, which clients should obtain by issuing a GET operation. If the _revision provided in a PUT request is missing or stale, the operation will be rejected

session_cache_enabled.Description: Reuse previously negotiated security parameters during handshake

tag.Description: Set of opaque identifiers meaningful to the user

display_name.Description: The display name of this resource. Defaults to ID if not set

enabled.Description: Whether the load balancer service is enabled

error_log_level.Description: Load balancer engine writes information about encountered issues of different severity levels to the error log. This setting is used to define the severity level of the error log

logical_router_id.Description: Logical Tier1 Router to which the Load Balancer is to be attached

virtual_server_ids.Description: Virtual servers associated with this Load Balancer

display_name.Description: The display name of this resource. Defaults to ID if not set

ha_persistence_mirroring.Description: A boolean flag which reflects whether persistence entries will be synchronized to the HA peer

persistence_shared.Description: A boolean flag which reflects whether the cookie persistence is private or shared

purge_when_full.Description: A boolean flag which reflects whether entries will be purged when the persistence table is full

timeout.Description: Persistence expiration time in seconds, counted from the time all the connections are completed

fall_count.Description: Number of consecutive checks that must fail before marking it down

interval.Description: The frequency at which the system issues the monitor check (in seconds)

monitor_port.Description: If the monitor port is specified, it would override pool member port setting for healthcheck. A port range is not supported

receive.Description: Expected data, if specified, can be anywhere in the response and it has to be a string, regular expressions are not supported

revision.Description: The _revision property describes the current revision of the resource. To prevent clients from overwriting each other's changes, PUT operations must include the current _revision of the resource, which clients should obtain by issuing a GET operation. If the _revision provided in a PUT request is missing or stale, the operation will be rejected

send.Description: If both send and receive are not specified, then just a TCP connection is established (3-way handshake) to validate server is healthy, no data is sent.

enabled.Description: whether the virtual server is enabled

max_concurrent_connections.Description: If not specified, connections are unlimited

max_new_connection_rate.Description: If not specified, connection rate is unlimited
